FuncDef:
The min-echo-rx-interval command configures a minimum interval at which one-arm BFD echo session packets are received.
The undo min-echo-rx-interval command restores the default minimum interval at which one-arm BFD echo session packets are received. The min-echo-rx-interval command configures a minimum interval at which one-arm BFD echo session packets are received. The undo min-echo-rx-interval command restores the default minimum interval at which one-arm BFD echo session packets are received. By default, the minimum interval is 1000 ms.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the minimum interval at which one-arm BFD echo session packets are received.
The value is an integer that ranges from 3 to 1000, in milliseconds.

Examples: [*HUAWEI] bfd session bind peer-ip 10.10.20.2 interface 100GE 1/0/1 one-arm-echo
ExtraInfo: After creating a one-arm BFD echo session, you can configure a minimum interval at which one-arm BFD echo session packets are received.
